mods.note: D.O.No.81/2. Govormnent of Bahrain, Education Department, © 27th.January 1945 ' 0 Bahrain Receipt No.s^/... Dat e.^A^: In October 1944 ^ou were kind enough to let me have one hundredweight of news-print paper for the use of the schools. We have not been able to obtain any paper whatsoever from other sources since then and are again running short.Gen you possibly let me some more? I shall be most grateful if you can do so. Major T.Hickinbotham,C.I.E*,0.3.E., H.B.M’s Political Agent, Bahrain. /«yU^ - ^ 70. S'//'AI I- ( 1 ) > D.O.No. ^^'3- My dear V^aielin, Political Agency, Bahrain, The 27th January, 1945. & Reference your demi-official letter No.8l/2 dated the 27th January, 1945. 2. I regret I cannot provide any more paper. Yours sincerely, n. % F.J. Wake1in, Esq,, Director of Education, Bahrain.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 5; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains copies of two letters, both dated 27 January 1945. The first is from Frederick James Wakelin, Director of Education in Bahrain, and constitutes a request for paper. The second is the reply from Major Tom Hickinbotham, the Political Agent in Bahrain, expressing regret for not being to provide any paper.Folio 4 is internal office notes.
